data.text: Weary in my soul,
And I will say to the Lord, Do not teach me to be impious;
Is it good before thee if I be unrighteous?
Or dost thou see as a mortal sees?
Or is thy life human,
That thou hast inquired into mine iniquity,
For thou knowest that I have not committed iniquity:
Thy hands have formed me and made me;
Remember that thou hast made me as clay,
Hast thou not poured me out like milk,
And thou didst clothe me with skin and flesh,
And thou didst bestow upon me life and mercy,
Having these things in thyself, I know that thou canst do all things;
And if I should sin, thou watchest me;
Or if I should be ungodly, woe is me:
For I am hunted like a lion for slaughter;
Renewing against me my torture:
Why then didst thou bring me out of the womb?
And I become as if I had not been?
Is not the time of my life short?
Before I go whence I shall not return,
To a land of perpetual darkness, where there is no light,
